cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest paralleling the Florida east coast and approaching the Georgia/South Carolina coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of southern South Carolina near the Charleston/Savannah River area (or very close offshore)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect from Savannah River to Edisto Beach, SC (just south of Charleston)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning in effect along the Florida east coast from north of Golden Beach to Fernandina Beach, FL and the Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from Florida through South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds increasingly likely (58% chance); hurricane-force gusts possible (10% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 5–8 ft inundation above ground level if peak surge coincides with high tide along the Charleston harbor and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with locally higher totals possible, producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, coastal flooding, and possible infrastructure/road closures impacting port operations.
